Crimes.Crime_Name: Concealment or amputation of public records under the Access to Information Act
Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: Section 24(1)(a) of the Public Servants Disclosure Protection (PSDP) Act
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged concealment and fabrication of public records
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Investigation by PSIC and legal advice
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Public Servants Disclosure Protection Act (PSDP Act), Access to Information Act
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Submission of written arguments by applicant
Crimes.Institutional_Action: PSIC refused to investigate under s. 24(1)(a)
Crimes.Government_Body_or_Authority: Public Sector Integrity Commissioner (PSIC), Office of the Information Commissioner (OIC)
Crimes.Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Disclosure adequately dealt with under another process (OIC)
Crimes.Individual_Status_or_Claim: Applicant making a public interest disclosure
Crimes.Temporal_Context: After OIC response and time-barred complaint
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness of PSIC’s discretion and procedural fairness
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Concealment, fabrication, and mishandling of public records
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness and reasonableness under administrative law
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Retaliation or lack of accountability in public sector
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Public servant or individual making disclosure
Crimes.Legal_Basis: Failure to investigate alleged record tampering

Crimes.Crime_Name: Fabrication of evidence to affect tribunal proceedings
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Refusal to investigate disclosure under PSDP Act
Crimes.Governing_Law: Public Servants Disclosure Protection Act (PSDP Act), s. 24(1)
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Prior handling by OIC considered sufficient
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show inadequacy of prior process
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: No challenge to applicant’s credibility noted
Crimes.Legal_Rule: PSIC may decline disclosures already addressed under another Act
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Notice and opportunity to respond before refusal
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged fabrication of evidence in tribunal context
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim not investigated; deemed better handled by OIC
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to PSIC decision
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Met: applicant informed and allowed written response
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: OIC’s prior engagement and jurisdictional limits
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities (implied in administrative context)
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Disclosure already addressed via OIC process
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Disclosure already addressed under another Act
